Package edu.uark.csce3513.team18.lasertag

Class Database

java.lang.Object
edu.uark.csce3513.team18.lasertag.Database
public class Database extends Object
The Database class can be used to interface with the PostgreSQL database to store and retrieve player information.
Author:
Ben Easterling

  • Constructor Details

    • Database

      public Database(String url, String username, String password)
      Creates a new Database object.
      Parameters:
      url - The URL of the PostgreSQL database
      username - The username of the PostgreSQL database
      password - The password of the PostgreSQL database

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public void connect() throws SQLException
      Establishes connection with the database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - An error is thrown if the connection is unsuccessful.

    • getPlayers

      public List<Player> getPlayers() throws SQLException
      Gets a list of all of the players in the database.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing all of the players in the database
      Throws:
      SQLException - An error is thrown if the query is unsuccessful

    • createPlayer

      public void createPlayer(Player player) throws SQLException
      Creates a new player in the database.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to insert into the database
      Throws:
      SQLException - An error is thrown if the update is unsuccessful

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer(int id) throws SQLException
      Gets the player with the specified ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the player to retrieve from the database
      Returns:
      A player object containing all of the information for the requested player.
      Throws:
      SQLException - An error is thrown if the query is unsuccessful

    • updatePlayer

      public void updatePlayer(Player player) throws SQLException
      Updates the provided player in the database.
      Parameters:
      player - The object of the player to update, containing the new field values
      Throws:
      SQLException - An error is thrown if the update is unsuccessful

    • deletePlayer

      public void deletePlayer(int id) throws SQLException
      Deletes the player with the specified ID from the database.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the player to delete
      Throws:
      SQLException - An error is thrown if the update is unsuccessful

    • deleteAllPlayers

      public void deleteAllPlayers() throws SQLException
      Deletes all players from the players table, but preserves the table schema.
      Throws:
      SQLException - An error is thrown if the update is unsuccessful
